title: April Gold (Love Endures)
features: Marilla Reed’s world changed in an instant. Now she’s left to pick up the pieces and scrape together a new existence in a run-down neighborhood far from what she knows. Marilla struggles to adapt, wondering what kind of future she’ll have with no chance of college. . .and no chance of love. Then the jealousy of a neighborhood man flares, and survival takes on a new meaning. . . .
description: Love endures is a series of Grace Livingston Hill classics. . . Marilla Reed was no stranger to the good life—until her father’s death turned her world upside down. Now she struggles with a new way of living while wondering what the future holds.

GRACE LIVINGSTON HILL (1865–1947) is known as the pioneer of Christian romance. Grace wrote over one hundred faith-inspired books during her lifetime. When her first husband died, leaving her with two daughters to raise, writing became a way to make a living, but she always recognized storytelling as a way to share her faith in God. She has touched countless lives through the years and continues to touch lives today. Her books feature moving stories, delightful characters, and love in its purest form. Grace Livingston Hill began writing stories in 1877 at the tender age of twelve and didn’t stop until her death in 1947. But what may be more amazing is that she has sold over 84 million copies and is still loved by young and old alike.

I really think the writing the characters were delightful and exciting!!! You just cannot relay their conversations without delight. I loved it! Hard to put down writing. Funny. Very touching and tear full at some parts. And totally inspiring all over (Larik Burci
2013-06-02) I would recommend that any young girl, or any woman for that matter, read all of her books. (Cindi Burleson

2013-06-28)It's a tale of how each of the Reeds overcome their new lifestyle - a move to a neglected neighborhood and entering employment. They question God and find He is with them in their new life. Even with pain in their lives, they learn to lean on the Lord and find joy in their circumstances. (Miss Pippi
“‘Oh, God, help me! Help! Help! Help!’ her heart was crying out. . . .”

Young and beautiful, Marilla Reed led a comfortable life. With plans to begin college the following fall, her future looked promising, too. Until her father’s death and the wave of economic depression sweeping the country turned her world upside down. Now she must pick up the pieces of a life gone awry and scrape together a new existence far from what she once knew. A run-down neighborhood, no hope of college, and no chance at love. . .Marilla is left wondering what kind of future she’ll have.
Then, just as her dreary world begins to brighten, the jealousy of a neighborhood man flares and survival takes on new meaning.
